core:description.text: An entrance hall opening directly onto a foggy canal landing. At the center, double doors stand open, revealing short stone steps that lead down to a wet, indistinct street or canal edge veiled in mist. Inside, the floor is pale stone tile with a long metal drainage grate running toward the doors and a rectangular mat placed in front of the threshold. Along the left wall, a wooden rail of coat pegs holds several dark cloaks. Below and nearby, there is a low boot-scraper and a simple stand with towels draped over it. The walls are pale plaster with dark wood wainscoting and trim. Heavy light-colored curtains frame the doorway, tied back to keep clear of the damp. On either side of the doors, wall-mounted lamps with glass shades cast a warm light. On the right wall, a large board is filled with evenly spaced hooks and small labeled tags, resembling an organized key rack.
